</subject>       <abstract><p>Abstract copyright UK Data Service and data collection copyright owner.</p>The <I>Human Rights Atlas, 2012</I> dataset was created for the ESRC-funded Human Rights Atlas Project. The dataset collates data from over 200 indicators, across 190 countries and territories. The data are also available on the <a href="http://www.humanrightsatlas.org/" title="Human Rights Atlas Project">Human Rights Atlas Project</a> website, where further information about the project may also be found.<br> <br> Further information may also be found on the ESRC <a href="http://www.esrc.ac.uk/my-esrc/grants/RES-189-25-0308/read" title="Human Rights Atlas">Human Rights Atlas</a> and <a href="http://www.esrc.ac.uk/my-esrc/grants/ES.K00803X.1/read" title="Extending the Human Rights Atlas">Extending the Human Rights Atlas</a> award webpages.<br> <br> </abstract>       <abstract><B>Main Topics</B>:<br>The dataset includes economic and social indicators from a number of open data sources forming a time series for over 220 countries, dependencies and territories from 1981 to 2012. The dataset contains 160 variables, reduced from the previous edition, which included 229.<br> </abstract>       <sumDscr>         <timePrd event="start" date="1981-01-01T00:00:00Z">1981</timePrd>         <timePrd event="end" date="2012-01-01T00:00:00Z">2012</timePrd>         <collDate event="single" date="2012-01-01T00:00:00Z">2012</collDate>         <nation>Multi-nation</nation>         <geogUnit>Countries</geogUnit>         <anlyUnit>Administrative units (geographical/political)</anlyUnit>         <universe>Cross-national</universe>         <universe>The data cover 200 different measures of economic, social, political, and legal life in 220 different countries across the world.</universe>         <dataKind>Numeric data</dataKind>         <dataKind> Aggregate (macro) level</dataKind>       </sumDscr>     </stdyInfo>     <method>       <dataColl>         <timeMeth>Cross-sectional (one-time) study</timeMeth>         <timeMeth>Time series data collected as part of a research project.</timeMeth>         <dataCollector>Farquhar, D., University of Essex. Department of Government</dataCollector>         <sampProc>No sampling (total universe)</sampProc>         <deviat>220 countries</deviat>         <collMode>Compilation or synthesis of existing material</collMode>         <sources />         <weight>No weighting used</weight>         <cleanOps>B</cleanOps>       </dataColl>     </method>     <dataAccs>       <setAvail>         <accsPlac>UK Data Service</accsPlac>       </setAvail>       <useStmt>         <specPerm>Open</specPerm>         <restrctn>The depositor has specified that registration is not required.</restrctn>         <contact><a href=http://www.ukdataservice.ac.uk/help/get-in-touch.aspx>Get in touch</a></contact>         <conditions>These data are available to any user for any purpose under the <a href="http://creativecommons.org/licenses/by/4.0/" title="Creative Commons Attribution 4.0 International Licence (CC BY 4.0)">Creative Commons Attribution 4.0 International Licence (CC BY 4.0)</a></conditions>       </useStmt>     </dataAccs>     <othrStdyMat>       <relPubl>See the <a href="http://www.humanrightsatlas.org/" title="Human Rights Atlas Project">Human Rights Atlas Project</a> website for details of publications.<br></relPubl>       <relPubl>   </relPubl>       <othRefs>Language Of Study Description: English</othRefs>       <othRefs>Language Of Study Documentation: English</othRefs>     </othrStdyMat>   </stdyDscr> </codeBook>
